info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 29 at 4:41PM EDT until August 29 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Indiana County in west central Pennsylvania... Southeastern Armstrong County in west central Pennsylvania... * Until 530 PM EDT. * At 441 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles southeast of Ford City, or 8 miles northeast of Vandergrift, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. * Locations impacted include... Rural Valley, West Lebanon, Dayton, Chevy Chase Heights, Ernest, Marion Center, Elderton, Creekside, Plumville, Shelocta, Atwood, and Dixonville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
